Author: dannydog
Content: By using GetGame().GetPlayers() it avoids the need to think logically on something as simple as that as it can be written from scratch using existing game functions

Author: dannydog
Content: ie; when a player connects, store them in a list. when they disconnect remove them from a list.

Author: oytun
Content:
My ServerStart.bat:
```@echo off
color 0a
title Spook DayZ Server Monitor
:Serverstart
echo Sunucu Baslatiliyor
F:
cd "F:\Steam Game Library\steamapps\common\DayZServer"
echo Spook DayZ Server Monitor... Aktif !
start "DayZ" /min /wait DayZServer_x64.exe "-mod=@Trader;@KillFeed;@BuildAnywhere;@InventoryPlus;@LogBaseBuilding" -config=serverDZ.cfg -port=2302 "-profiles=ServerName" -dologs -adminlog -freezecheck -scriptDebug=true -cpuCount=4
ping 127.0.0.1 -n 15 >NUL
echo DayZ Sunucusu Kapatiliyor ... Yeniden Baslatiliyor!
ping 127.0.0.1 -n 5 >NUL
cls
goto Serverstart```

Author: mikero
Content:
pay attention bis or ignore the typos (like you usually do) in your scripts
porto\endDebug.c
enum CollisionFlags
{
    FIRSTCONTACT,    //<In many cases only collided=true/false is enough
    NEARESTCONTACT    //<We want only one, the nearest contact
    ONLYSTATIC        //<Only static objects
    ONLYDYNAMIC        //<Only dynamic objects
    ONLYWATER,        //<Only water components (legacy support for "walk on geometry")
    ALLOBJECTS        //<Valid when CF_FIRST_CONTACT, we get first contact for each object
}
missing ; and missing comma separation

Author: Deleted User
Content: So OnlyWater would make object/player stay on water

Author: mikero
Content:
proto\Enentity.c
class ParamEnum: Managed  
class ParamEnumArray: array<ref ParamEnum>
class Attribute
class EditorAttribute

all missing ending ;

Author: mikero
Content: (but you want to break the rules, don't you bis, and alter things so they become, like sqf, uncheckable for syntax errors)

Author: mikero
Content: traditionally in C the family of languages class bodies{,,,,};//<<< have a semi colon

Author: dannydog
Content: You only really need to put semi colons at the end of variable assignments and not functions.

Author: mikero
Content: class bodies have semis, but bis want to change the rules so that' they're optional

Author: dannydog
Content: Personally i dont find any benefit of adding ; where they're not needed

Author: mikero
Content: possibly true, but you can't have it both ways and expect any commercial grade lint checker (for any language) let you get away with it.

Author: mikero
Content: I can't think of a scenaro at the moment where (lack of) a semi would cause a context issue. but this harkens back to the crap we put up with in flashpoint sqS where end of line was end of statement.

Author: mikero
mikero
Content: the c family does not treat newlines as meaningfull
